title: Effects of cash withdrawal at TJS Bank

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

The central bank sells <math alttext="$100,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$100,000</mtext></mstyle></math> worth of bonds in the open market to Casey, who withdraws cash from her checking account at <math alttext="T J S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TJS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Bank to pay for the bonds. The banking system has limited reserves, the required reserve ratio is <math alttext="25%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and banks hold no excess reserves.

(a) What is the amount by which <math alttext="T J S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TJS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Bank’s liabilities change as a result of Casey’s cash withdrawal? Explain.

(b) Calculate the change in required reserves for <math alttext="T J S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>TJS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Bank as a result of Casey’s cash withdrawal. Show your work.

(c) Have Casey’s financial asset holdings increased, decreased, or stayed the same? Explain.

(d) Based on the central bank’s open market sale of bonds, calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can change throughout the banking system. Show your work.

(e) How will the change in the money supply in part (d) affect unemployment and the price level in the short run? Explain.
